text: Rodolfo "Rudy" Fernández y Farrés (born 4 April 1985 in Mallorca) is a Spanish basketball player. He is a 6'6" (1.98 m)Rudy Fernández official NBA.com player page 6'6" 1.98m in height. He is also a member of the Spanish national team. He comes from a keen basketball family; his father also was a professional basketball player. He first started playing in the Joventut Badalona team, in the ACB (2003-2008). In 2008 he left the Joventut team and started playing for the Portland Trail Blazers in the NBA league. His first match with this team was against his old friend Pau Gasol. His second year joining the NBA was not as good as he expected, he got backache several times. In December 2009, Fernández underwent microdiscectomy surgery for a herniated disc. It was causing leg pain. He has also joined other teams, such as the Real Madrid (2011) and the Denver Nuggets. On July 4, 2012, Fernández signed a 3-year deal with Real Madrid.REAL MADRID brings back Fernandez He has won five medals: two silver in the European Championship and also in the Olympic Games, and three golden in the World Championship, and two in the European Championship. ==References== Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Denver Nuggets players Category:Medalists at the 2008 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 2012 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic medalists for Spain Category:Olympic silver medalists for Spain Category:People from Palma de Mallorca Category:Portland Trail Blazers players Category:Shooting guards Category:Small forwards Category:Spanish basketball players
